graphs module¶

graphs.adl_cov(num_relays, v4_covered, top_num_nc, asn4s, asn4s_nc)¶

projection of additional coverage if AS with most uncovered relay would cover their IP space with ROA

graphs.adl_cov_bw(nw_bandwidth, v4_bw_covered, top_bw_nc, asn4s, asn4s_nc)¶

graphs bar plot of additional bandwidth covered by ROA, if top ROA AS were to fully cover their IP space

graphs.adl_cov_guards(num_relays, v4_covered, top_num_nc, asn4s, asn4s_nc, n2)¶

graphs ROA coverage for guards if more AS were to cover their IP space

graphs.guards(relays)¶

input a list of relays and filter out non-guard relays, return a list of guards

Parameters

relays – (list) list of relay objects

Returns

(list) list of relay objects that all has the guard flag

graphs.invalid_roa(bad_asn, bad_pl, bad_asn_and_pl, v4_invalid)¶

graph the distribution of invalid reasons (mismatch ASN, max length violation, or both) across all invalid roa

graphs.main(args)¶

Put consensus file location and ‘y’ or ‘n’ indicating whether to only process guard relays as command line arguments. Analyze relays in 1 consensus file, including getting ROA coverage, IP prefix, ASN etc. Call graphing functions (all functions in this file excpet parse_arguments can produce a graph) at the end of main function to graph various specs for this consensus file

Example Call: python graphs.py C:UserssunsiDocumentsGitHubtor-rpkiprocessed2021-06-01-06-processed.pickle n
